conclusion: Analyze given information and use properties of radar emissions and speed of light to determine distance.
Each emission lasts 1 microsecond and interval between emissions is 100 microseconds.
Time between two consecutive emissions is 10^-4 seconds.
Distance traveled by light in one emission is 300 meters.
Distance traveled by light in the interval between emissions is 3000 meters.
In the figure, ab = bc and total distance covered by light in interval is 3000 meters.
Distance from radar to obstacle is half of total distance covered in interval, which is 1500 meters.
The distance between the obstacle and the radar is 1500 meters.
